text: for custom modules 2, is there a way to have an html field?
<@U3T21PDBK> I believe you can use html in a text or textarea. It just won't have syntax highlighting
<@U7V9DQ31P> bummer. I was hoping to mimmick HubSpot’s html module in the market place and  use an html field as part of a module... I guess I could clone their html module and build one off of that?
the idea is to keep the code areas hidden from the end-users. keeps things less prone to breaking.
odd that that emoji is called persevere, looks more like  “my world is ending”

Hi community, maybe someone has found out a solution for this. In HubSpot when you insert a form field in a landing page the form module gives you three options: 1-The chance to choose one or several mails to send the converted form 2- The chance to include it in a workflow 3- The chance to choose a follow up email.
The issue begins when you use a form field within a Custome Module
then the form options disapear
we have managed to figure out how to get them back by adding Hubl code into the CM 
We have found out the hubl code for adding the option for follow up email and workflow but we don't get to the code needed for getting notification email option.                                              This is the code working for follow up option
simple_email_for_live_id="{{ module.followupemail_field }}"
  form_follow_ups_follow_up_type="simple"
This one for workflows options
form_follow_ups_workflow_id = {{ module.workflow_field }}
and this is what we have tried for emailnotifications but in this case is not working
notifications_are_overridden=True
           notifications_override_email_addresses =[{{ module.email_field }} (edited)
                                                               We have managed to include emails for notification with
notifications_are_overridden=True
          notifications_override_email_addresses =["<mailto:jedwar@inboundemotion.com|jedwar@inboundemotion.com>", "<mailto:jnavarrete@inboundemotion.com|jnavarrete@inboundemotion.com>"]

but this means you have to code in the module every mail you want to send notification, the option does not appear in the settings for the user to easyly add emails.
anyone has find themselves in the same issue? Any ideas from HubSpotters?
that would be hard to type with the : : notation
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
does editing a module v2 get super laggy for anyone else? I’m using Chrome 67.0.3396.87 (Official Build)

John - Yes! It’s basically unworkable right now. It takes forever to publish, and it is so laggy when typing in it that it takes multiple seconds for the action to take place. Right now I need to write in another editor and then paste it into the module to even be able to work in our clients portals….
If you are having performance issues please report them here: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1528902579000823>

but that actually makes it harder for customers to embed stuff: youtube, vimeo, twitter widget, maps, addthis or other sharing widgets, 3rd party icons, other exiting service or still-to-be invented that provides code to easily embed their widgets in your content. more chances customers need that then breaking code.

I dont think this is possible but not sure if anyone else has tried using Jinja workarounds or anything to accomplish, is there a way we can using some thing like the `batch()` filter with the Menu Tag so we can have every X items in the menu wrapped in a div or something like that
I know I can use JS to simply grab the menu and split it all but I was curious in seeing id there is a way to do this
The simple menu you can do that with. BUT the advanced menu doesnt exspose the loop.
